main event: Two observers viewing the stars through a telescope spotted a star-like object that moved quickly and changed colors in Tinley Park, Illinois on August 4, 1965.
interesting points: The object moved at an angular rate of 2-4 degrees per second., The object was initially white and turned to a faint red color., The duration of the sighting was approximately 16-17 seconds., Witnesses described a sudden appearance and disappearance of the object., They reported no sound or visible trail from the object.
witness description: Two civilians who were using a telescope to view the stars.
